metadata.title: CVE-2024-27354 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in phpseclib 1.x before 1.0.23, 2.x before 2.0.47,and 3.x before 3.0.36. An attacker can construct a malformed certificatecontaining an extremely large prime to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption for an isPrime primality check). NOTE: this issue wasintroduced when attempting to fix CVE-2023-27560.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27354` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-phpseclib - 2.0.47-1
No subscription required

php-phpseclib3 - 3.0.37-1
No subscription required

php-seclib - 1.0.23-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-phpseclib package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.47-1').
php-phpseclib3 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.37-1').
phpseclib package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.23-1').
